events.name: WeekEnd BeMyApp spécial objets connectés pour le Téléthon
events.about:
A l’occasion du Téléthon 2012, une édition spéciale des WeekEnds BeMyApp est organisée afin d’impliquer la communauté mobile pour cette cause. Il s’agira de développer des applications mobiles en utilisant des objets connéctés.

Le principe des WeekEnds BeMyApp est de réunir les compétences complémentaires pour créer des applications mobiles en 48h. 

Pour cette édition, il s’agira d’inventer et de créer des applications autour des objets connectés (mobilier urbain, vitrine communicante, robotique etc.) Chaque équipe participante s’engagera à verser ses premiers bénéfices à l’AFM.

De plus pendant tout le Téléthon, les spectateurs pourront suivre en direct les projets développés et voter pour leur application préférée. Le samedi 8 décembre à 22h, l’équipe qui aura récolté le plus de votes remportera le prix du public. Si les 25000 votes sont atteints avant cette date limite, un don de 5000€ sera fait au Téléthon.

Le prix du jury sera décerné quant à lui, par des professionnels de l’écosystème du monde mobile et des objets connéctés. Le lauréat de ce prix se verra remettre par Orange la somme de 5000 euros d’aide au développement, pour finaliser l’application.

Si vous avez une idée d’application, si vous êtes développeur, designeur ou marketeur et que vous avez envie de rejoindre cette noble cause et le bon esprit de BeMyApp, inscrivez-vous sans tarder.

events.name: AngelHack Fall 2012 Paris (the unofficial LeWeb Hackathon)
events.about:
Ready to take your big idea to the next level? Then join us for Paris next AngelHack, where winning teams will receive 6-8 weeks of mentorship and be flown into Silicon Valley for a weekend of events including a Global Demo Day to A-list investors and media, Site visits to, Google, Facebook, Google Ventures, VIP dinners, and ragging parties with the Valley startup community. This is not your typical weekend hackathon! This is the big leagues! This is AngelHack and you cant afford to miss it.

AngelHack Fall 2012 Fast Facts
  • 2500 amazing developers & designers in 11 cities for you to work with
  • Great food, shwag, nerf guns, helicopters, and awesomness all around
  • Over $650,000 in prizes, including trips to Silicon Valley for the top 25 teams
  • Media coverage and all star investor judges to help validate those whacky hack ideas of yours

WANT 50 FREE CARDS FROM MOO FOR YOUR ANGELHACK PARIS PROJECT? 

What should I build?
Create a prototype (hack) of something that you believe solves a big problem. You dont need a business plan or anything crazy like that, but you should be able to show the big idea potential of your hack. AngelHack is a launchpad for you to flush out and validate projects youve always wanted to build. Previous winners include: Appetas, GiveGo, TapFame, SnapStore, ShareBrowse, Kloutron, & Blue Dragon Security.

What are the rules?
All code must be FRESH. Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, wireframes, logo, and user flows. You can even build hardware. But to make things completely fair you can not write any code whatsoever until the hackathon starts. All code must be built at AngelHack.

For more info visit our Rules and FAQ pages.

Good Luck,
Gregory Gopman
AngelHack Founder / CEO

As seen in

*tickets are non-refundable

events.name: Shipper des API, du Web avec Scala et de l'Android en mode Hackathon.
events.about:
Un hands on pour voir ce que lon peut faire avec Scala et Java pour créer et livrer un produit rapidement en mode hackathon. La soirée sera animée par Rand Hindi, Pierre-Yves Ricau et Jonathan Winandy. 

Le hands on se déroulera en binôme avec la partie Scala et Android en même temps.

Pour participer à la soirée, vous aurrez besoin absolument de votre propre machine.

Pour informations :

  • On ne fait pas de Scala sur Android, ce nest pas sérieux en mode hackathon !
  • Pour la partie sur Scala, il est mieux de connaître un peu Scala/sbt (avoir suivit le cours sur Coursera par exemple).
  • Pour la partie sur Android, il est préférable davoir un téléphone qui tourne sur Android, et de connaître un petit peu/de loin Android.

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Paris, France
events.about:
Be part of the app revolution!

By registering, you’ll be joining thousands of developers worldwide as we build apps for the next generation of Windows.

Expert Help, Free Resources

Microsoft app experts, developers and trainers will be available on-site to assist your learning and coding. Learn about building Windows Store apps today – download the info, tools and resources you need now. 

Windows Azure Mobile Services

Does your Store app idea include cloud services or storage? Check out Get started withMobile Services –registered student WOWZAPP 2012 participants are eligible for a FREE temporary student Windows Azure subscription!– supplies are limited so be sure to register now!

events.name: Test the Web Forward - Paris
events.about:
Test the Web Forward - October 26th & 27th Paris, France

 Follow Us! @testthewebfwd & #testtwf

Test the Web Forward brings you closer to the very specifications that you use to craft web experiences and has you discover how you can shape the future of the web.

Over the course of the event, not only will you learn to understand how to read specifications and understand the state of support among different browsers, but you will also create robust tests along with the editors of various standards to ensure browsers implement these features consistently. At the end of it, you will gain a deeper understanding of browser internals & how you can write clear, robust tests.

We do expect you to be capable of hand-coding in HTML, CSS, & JavaScript, but there will be experts from Adobe, Facebook, Google, Microsoft, Mozilla, Opera, the W3C, as well as independent developers to guide you step-by-step to create tests that can help move the web forward. Food, drinks & music will be provided.

More details can be found here: http://testthewebforward.org/paris-2012.html

Agenda

7:15pm - 7:45pm Break, Food is served

events.name: HackDayParis Connected TV
events.about:
HackDayParis Connected TV is a weekend event during which groups of designers and developers gather to imagine, design and build innovative projects around the connected television.

This hackathon will take place at Le Camping, in the prestigious Palais Brongniart.

Entry is free and includes food and drinks. Join us!

More on http://hackdayparis.org
events.address: Palais Brongniart Place de la bourse

events.name: zNight - Hackathon Google TV
events.about:
La zNight, c’est l’occasion de faire la démonstration de vos talents de développeur. Entrez dans une compétition pendant toute une soirée et montrez que vous êtes le meilleur!
Une nuit de développement, sur un thème d’actualité. Nous vous fournissons de quoi boire, de quoi manger, afin que vous puissiez vous concentrer sur l’essentiel.
Code, fun & beer!

Le thème: Venez découvrir Google TV afin d’anticiper sa prochaine arrivée en France! Cet évènement est l’occasion d’imaginer la création ou le portage de nouvelles applications sur une plateforme encore peu exploitée. Il peut aussi répondre à une simple envie de se tenir informé de l’avancée et des possibilités d’Android!

Le challenge: Vous aurez une nuit pour développer une application Google TV. Aucun thème n’est imposé, et des idées d’applications seront proposées. Le défi sera d’intégrer cette application pour qu’elle soit agréable d’utilisation pour le système. C’est une compétition, il faudra donc être le meilleur! Vous pourrez participer seul, ou en équipe.


La récompense: Un jury que nous révèlerons quelques jours avant la soirée évaluera les applications réalisées à l’issue du concours. Les meilleures applications seront récompensées et les développeurs pourront gagner leur box Google TV. Ainsi, les développeurs auront les moyens de finaliser leurs travaux.

Contact: znight@zenika.com

Déroulement de la soirée

19h30 Accueil
20h00-21h00 Présentation de Google TV
21h30-09h30 Hackathon
10h00-11h00 Présentation
11h30 Délibération du jury

events.name: SWAF Hackathon
events.about:
Semantic Web and Agri-Food Workshop and Hackathon

 

The workshop will focus on the ways semantic web and related technologies (ontologies, linked data, etc.) can be used across the food and agriculture supply chain to facilitate the exchange of information and enable the creation of additional services for farmers, transporters and processors of food, retailers and final consumers, in effect the whole supply chain. Supply chain integration is a holy grail in many industries but given the specific challenges of the agri-food sector and its importance to society, to the economy, and to the environment, such integration is vital.

Semantic technologies, ontologies and related technologies have grown considerably in maturity in recent years. This workshop seeks papers presenting all aspect of these technologies ranging from position papers to implemented systems and their evaluation. We are particularly interested in examples where semantic technologies are used to cross the boundaries between sub-sectors of the agri-food production and supply chain. Discussions of existing or proposed ontologies are welcome.

 

Part of the SmartAgrimatics International Conference taking place at Hotel Forest Hill – La Villette, 28 ter Avenue Corentin Cariou, 75 019 Paris

  

Full details of the workshop are available here: http://www.agrixchange.org/sam-workshop/semantic-web-and-

Following the workshop a hackathon will take place. For further details about the hackathon please go here.

This ticket allow you access to the workshop and hackathon only and not the conference as a whole.

events.name: HackDay Factory DataSources
events.about:
As you may know, Joshfire has a strong hacker culture ;-) We regularly hold company-wide hack days where everybody is free to work on a small project of his choice to be demoed at the end of the day. It is a fantastic way to foster innovation and creativity.

The Joshfire Factory is an open ecosystem. We have already fully documented the development process of templates and everybody can freely import custom templates into the Factory. This is not true for Data Sources yet but we are working on making it possible soon.

How soon? Well, our next hack day is March 27th and it will be about creating new Data Sources for the Factory. And because Data wants to be Open, were actually opening this hack day to everyone!

So if you are a content provider, have a startup with an API, or just want to hack, you can join us on March 27th and we guarantee that by the end of the day youll be able to build cross-devices apps based on your data!

Well start the day with a short technical overview of our Data platform and then youll be able to hack on your own Data Source, with the help of Joshfire developers. As you can see in the template API, the Data Sources are fully written in JavaScript and normalize their data around schema.org, which makes them compatible with all the templates. So if you can write JavaScript, youll be able to bind your data to the Factory!

Register ASAP and contact us if you have any questions!

events.name: Hack The Elections
events.about:
The hackathon Civic Voxe.org
17 >> 18 March 2012

Participants
Are you a developer or designer? Or, you know nothing about computers but have ideas for applications that can afford to change the democratic debate at the time of the presidential elections? Voxe.org has a place for you to Hack the Elections!.

The concept
Hack the Elections! is a non-stop weekend of co-creating applications that will help people to vote in a more informed in the presidential election.

Voxe.org, fully open source, will provide its API and its partners, so that participants in a weekend, groups develop multi-disciplinary applications around the best ideas.

The best will be selected and awarded by a jury of experts selected by Geeklist.

The program

Saturday, March 17

10:00 Opening
10:30 Breakfast brainstorming
12:00 Pitch ideas
12:30 Team training
2:00 p.m. Conceptualization and implementation of applications

Sunday, March 18

10:00 Final Sprint
15:00 Presentation of prototypes
4:30 p.m. Cocktail Awards

The organizer

Voxe.org comparator is a multi-platform (web, iPhone, iPad, Android and BlackBerry) program that allows policy at any time have access to clear, neutral and innovative program content of all candidates for presidential election. Launched in France 6 February 2012 on the occasion of the presidential election, Voxe.org programs will provide candidates in other elections past and future: the United States, Germany and many others.

On the day of its launch, Voxe.org is praised by the French who were in just 14 days, nearly 50,000 to visit the site, carrying more than about 200,000 comparisons. Le Nouvel Observateur, LExpress, Owni, Canal +, AFP or Télématin, are among the major media have echoed this unique citizens initiative.

Hack the participation in elections! is free, subject to availability. Sign up now!

- NB: All entries are final. Thank you not take your place if you are sure to attend. -
events.address: Palais Brogniart Place de la Bourse
